frameDefinitions: The obtaining of a Requirement state of affairs or the presence of a Required_entity is profiled as a prerequisite for the obtaining or occurring of a Dependent state-of-affairs.
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
An Experiencer desires that an Event occur.
An Agent intends and takes steps towards bringing about a State_of_affairs or, metonymically, towards acquiring a Sought_entity .
This frame describes food and meal preparation.
The Invader enters a Land in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.
frameExamples: I only <t>wanted</t> one piece of candy.
Caitlin <t>baked</t> some cookies from the pre-packaged dough.
In August 1990 ,Iraq was <t>invading</t> Kuwait , which led to the Gulf war .
listRoleDefinitions: The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the state of affairs of the <fen>Requirement</fen> or the presence of the <fen>Required_entity</fen>.
The state-of-affairs that must obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.
An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person (or sentient being) who wishes for the <fen>Event</fen> to occur.
The change that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> would like to see.
This is the entity that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> wishes to be affected by some <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Location_of_event</fen> is the place involved in the desired <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> desires something.
Where the event takes place.  Note that this role is of extremely rare occurrence in this frame.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to  obtain a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to acquire.
A state or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to bring about. The Agent may but need not be a participant in that <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> is seeking to achieve a particular <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to acquire a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Cook</fen>  prepares the <fen>Produced_food</fen>.
The <fen>Produced_food</fen> is the result of a <fen>Cook</fen>'s efforts.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the cooking creation occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the cooking creation occurs.
The political area that is being crippled by the <fen>Invader</fen>'s entry.
The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the <fen>Land</fen> in a hostile manner.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Invader</fen> invades <fen>Land</fen>.
This role identifies the location where the <fen>Invader</fen> invades the <fen>Land</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Believe it or not, but this cake requires <fex>a pound of mild sausage</fex>.
<fex>In the US</fex>, putting this on the agenda requires the political weight and leadership of big city mayors.
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
I want that box <fex>on top of the other one</fex>.
Oh, so <fex>now</fex> you want to go to the zoo!
<fex>In the car</fex> I had desired nothing more than to get here, but now that I'm here...

<fex>Those states</fex> sought a remedy that would substantially change the company's business
practices.
Or the monstrous Saddam, who filled mass graves to bursting, invaded two neighboring countries, and avidly sought <fex>weapons of mass destruction</fex>.
His enemies sought <fex>his destruction</fex>.
The disclosure came as prosecutors successfully sought <fex>in federal court</fex> to keep Luise Garofalo behind bars.
<fex>Drew</fex> cooked dinner for his friends.
Drew prepared <fex>dinner</fex> for his friends.
Drew baked an apple pie <fex>at six int he morning</fex>.
Drew prepared the soup <fex> in the kitchen</fex>.
Henry II had made no attempt to invade <fex>France.</fex>
Indeed , three months later <fex>Hitler</fex> invaded Austria.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Michelai Graham Michigan State University American University
